abstract.text: Create, Update, and Synchronize data for collaborative applications.

inlineContent.text: Automerge makes it easier to store data for your app locally, update that data independently and asynchronously, and consistently merge updates and changes.
Seamless, consistent merging
Automerge is a
(CRDT), which allows concurrent changes on different devices to be merged automatically without requiring any central server.
For more information on the conflict resolution approach, see
at the
Immutable state
Automerge provides an immutable snapshot of the application state at a point in time.
As you make changes to a Automerge document, or merge in changes from elsewhere, the document collects and organizes those changes.
Read
for more information about accessing that history.
Network-agnostic
Automerge is a pure data structure library that does not care about networks, protocols, or transports.
Portable
Originally developed in JavaScript, Automerge uses
in the Rust language.
Automerge runs on Node.js, Electron, and modern browsers using the core library compiled to WebAssembly.
The Rust library exposes a C API for use with other languages.
The core is packaged as a static library within an XCFramework for use on Apple platforms.
The lowest layer lets you interact with the cross platform Automerge document API.
For more information on the core API layer, read
and
, and the methods exposed on
At a higher layer, this package provides a custom encoder and decoder that you can use to map Codable data types into the dynamic Automerge schema.
For more information on the Codable layer, read
The Automerge-swift package conforms an Automerge document to the
protocol.
To aid in sharing Automerge documents as a base type, it also defines a Uniform Type Identifier that you can use in your app to load, save, or share Automerge documents.
Read
for more information on the data types and saving an Automerge document directly.
, a separate module provided by the Automerge-swift package, provides additional methods to assist with debugging your app, and methods to walk and parse the Automerge document schema.
Read
to get a quick taste of how to use Automerge, or
for a walk-through that illustrates how to use Automerge within a demonstration app.
